panels.title: Status Code Ratio in the Last Hour
Total HTTP Request counts by Host

targets.expr: histogram_quantile($percentile, sum by(le, path) (rate(audius_cn_http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host", path=~"$path", status_code=~"$status_code"}[$__rate_interval])))
histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(le, host) (rate(audius_cn_http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host", path=~"$path", status_code=~"$status_code"}[$__rate_interval])))
sum by(host, path, status_code) (increase(audius_cn_http_request_duration_seconds_count{host=~"$host", environment=~"$env", path=~"$path", status_code=~"$status_code"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Request counts by Host, Path, and Status Code

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum by(le, host, path) (rate(audius_cn_http_request_duration_seconds_bucket{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host", path=~"$path", status_code=~"$status_code"}[$__rate_interval])))

panels.description:
CPU-second is one second of time on a CPU.
Process execution time has two measurements:
CPU time, or the amount of time that the CPU spent actively running the process; and
Wall time, or the amount of time that passes between you starting the process and the process ending.
panels.title: CPU Usage by Host (!!Assumes 16 cores!!)

panels.description: The lag in the nodejs event loop --- this is usually caused by blocking code taking too long e.g. job processors
panels.title: NodeJS Event Loop Lag by Host
NodeJS Heap Size Used by Host
